import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib as plt
import seaborn as sns
import datetime
import plotly.express as px
from datetime import date
source.3f1f9fad:
# Age Creation
data['Age']=2014-data['Year_Birth']

# Relationship Creation
data['Marital_Status']=data['Marital_Status'].replace({'Divorced':'Alone','Single':'Alone','Married':'In couple','Together':'In couple','Absurd':'Alone','Widow':'Alone','YOLO':'Alone'})

# Children Count Creation
data['Children']=data['Kidhome']+data['Teenhome']
data['Has_child'] = np.where(data.Children> 0, 'Has child', 'No child')
data['Children'].replace({3: "3 children",2:'2 children',1:'1 child',0:"No child"},inplace=True)

# Rearranging the dataFrame
data=data.rename(columns={'MntWines': "Wines",'MntFruits':'Fruits','MntMeatProducts':'Meat','MntFishProducts':'Fish','MntSweetProducts':'Sweets','MntGoldProds':'Gold'})
data=data[['Age','Education','Marital_Status','Income','Spending','Has_child','Children','Wines','Fruits','Meat','Fish','Sweets','Gold']]
data
source.8e9b8cf1: sns.catplot(x="Education", y="Wines", hue="Marital_Status", kind="bar", data=data, height=6, aspect=2.5)
source.1405a1fc:
bines = [1000, 10000, 30000, 60000, 170000]
name_given = ["Very Low Income", "Low Income", "Average Income", "High Income"]
data["Income"] = pd.cut(data["Income"], bines, labels=name_given)
data
source.2627caa6: sns.catplot(x="Income", y="Wines", hue="Has_child", kind="bar", data=data, height=6, aspect=2.5)
source.5d67a4a9: sns.catplot(x="Age", y="Wines", hue="Income", kind="bar", data=data, height=6, aspect=2.5)

### 1) People which Have high Income and Has no Child Consumes More Wine
### 2) People which having PHD Degree and are in a Relationship(Couple) Consumes More Wine
### 3) People between age 20-24 and 68-73 with High Income Consumes More Wine
